Write Stories with Pillow

project module

project.adjust_image_sizes(directories, min_width, min_height)

Crop each image into the unified size.

Parameters:

  • directories (tuple of str) – A tuple containing the four directories of images.

  • min_width (int) – The minimum width among four images. It’s used to unify the width of four images.

  • min_height (int) – The minium height among four images. It’s used to unify the height of of four images.

Returns:

A list containing four images which size are unified.

Return type:

list of image objects

project.check_photo_directories_and_sizes()

Ensure user specify the directory/filename of images when executing the program. Verify that the specified directory exists and that the images meet the required size.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the directory/filename of image doesn’t exist.

Returns:

A tuple containing the four directories of images.

Return type:

tuple of str

project.combine_image_descriptions(cropped, descriptions, unified_height)

Paste the text regions onto the images.

Parameters:

  • cropped (list of image objects) – A list containing four images with unified sizes.

  • descriptions (list of description objects) – A list containing four description objects for the text regions.

  • unified_height (int) – The unified height of the images.

Returns:

A list containing four image objects composed of images and text regions.

Return type:

list of image objects

project.connect_images(combined, width, height)

Connect four image objects composed of images and text regions.

Parameters:

  • combined (list of image objects) – A list containing four image objects composed of images and text regions.

  • width (int) – The unified width of each image object

  • height (int) – The unified height of each image object

Returns:

The final combined image object

Return type:

image object

project.create_description_objects(texts, img_width, img_height, font_size)

Create four description objects for text regions, each of wich composef of transparent black background and white text.

Parameters:

  • texts (list of str) – A list containing four description texts.

  • img_width (int) – The unified width of the images, and it’s used to define the width of the text region.

  • img_height (int) – The unified height of the images, and it’s used to define the height of the text region.

Returns:

A list containing four description objects for the text region.

Return type:

list of description objects

project.get_description_texts(width, height, font_size)

Prompt user for entering the description of each image and verify the word number doesn’t exceed the limitation.

Parameters:

  • width (int) – Width of unified image size.

  • height (int) – Height of unified image size.

Returns:

A list containing four description texts.

Return type:

list of str

project.get_min_sizes(directories)

Find the minimum width and minimum height among the four images.

Parameters:

directories (tuple) – A tuple containing the four directories of images.

Returns:

A tuple containing the minimum width and minimum height.

Return type:

tuple of int

project.get_new_image_name()

Prompt user for naming the new image file. Only alphabet, number and underscore are allowed.

Returns:

The name of the new output image.

Return type:

str

project.main()
project.set_font_size(width, height)

Set the font size. To ensure proportionality between the image size and font size, the ratio between the image and font is set to 593.4. This means that the size of images is 593.4 times larger than the size of one character.

Parameters:

  • width (int) – Width of the unified image size.

  • height (int) – Height of the unified image size.

Returns:

The font size of each character

Return type:

int
